description: Lemons are an excellent source of vitamin C. Vitamin C is an antioxidant and has been known to help your skin, immune system and reduce the risk of complications.

details.full_description:
Vitamin C and antioxidants are the two nutrients that are beneficial for heart health and help prevent heart diseases and stroke. And hopefully both the nutrients are present in lemon.

Amount of fibres present in lemon can also lower some risk for heart diseases.Consuming lemon juice can help reduce high blood pressure.

It helps strengthen the immune system against germs that cause the common cold and the flu. A glass of hot water with lemon juice and a large spoonful of honey can help aid cough and cold because lemons boosts our immune system.

Lemon has soluble fibres that helps to maintain the bowel movements and improves digestion. Pectin, the main fiber in lemons, helps to improve gut health.

It is said that drinking a glass of water with lemon juice in the morning can kick-start your digestion process as it will help your digestion to be healthy.
Squeezing lemon in a glass of lukewarm water with a tablespoon of honey can be an aid in weight loss. As it has a fibre that expands after ingestion, making you feel full sooner and longer.

Lemon and lemon juice are a rich source of vitamin C and antioxidants that help fight against deadly diseases like cancer. Compounds that are present in the lemon i.e. limonene and naringenin have anti-cancer properties.

Being a rich source of vitamin C, lemon is beneficial for oral disorders. Scurvy is a disease resulting from a lack of vitamin C leading to swollen gums, bleeding gums, etc.

Lemon juice may have that much audacity to cure the pain when applied locally to areas.
Collagen gives our skin a plump and flawless look. It helps to reduce the fine lines on the face and make your skin clear.

Lemon is a small yet power-packed fruit with all nutrients. Consuming lemon juice as part of a varied diet can make a person’s diet more nutritious and healthful. Lemon can be helpful with the main line of treatment of high blood pressure. Lemon contains two plant-compounds, such as hesperidin and diosmin — known to lower cholesterol.

title: Health Benefits Of Lemon
